IP.Name: STM32_WPAN
IP.About: BLE : BlueTooth Low Energy, designed for very low power operation. It supports multiple network topologies, including a point-to-point option used for data transfer, a broadcast option used for location services and a mesh option used for creating large-scale device networks.

RefParameter.Name: BLE_APPLICATION_TYPE
RefParameter.Description: Only Server profile is available when FreeRTOS is activated

RefParameter.Name: BLE_APPLICATION_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of application types, can be:
- Transparent mode
- Server profile
- Client profile
- Router profile

RefParameter.Name: BLE_APPLICATION_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of application types, can be:
- Transparent mode
- Server profile
- Client profile
- Router profile

RefParameter.Name: BT_SIG_BEACON
RefParameter.Description: You can enable this mode only if OTA mode is disabled

RefParameter.Name: BT_SIG_BLOOD_PRESSURE_SENSOR
RefParameter.Description: You can enable this mode only if BT SIG Beacon and OTA modes are disabled

RefParameter.Name: BT_SIG_HEALTH_THERMOMETER_SENSOR
RefParameter.Description: You can enable this mode only if BT SIG Beacon and OTA modes are disabled

RefParameter.Name: BT_SIG_HEART_RATE_SENSOR
RefParameter.Description: You can enable this mode only if BT SIG Beacon and OTA modes are disabled

RefParameter.Name: CUSTOM_P2P_SERVER
RefParameter.Description: You can enable this mode only if BT SIG Beacon and OTA modes are disabled

RefParameter.Name: CUSTOM_OTA
RefParameter.Comment: OTA: Over The Air Firmware Update

RefParameter.Name: CUSTOM_TEMPLATE
RefParameter.Description: Custom template

RefParameter.Name: CUSTOM_TEMPLATE
RefParameter.Description: Custom template can be enabled only if BT SIG Blood Pressure Sensor or BT SIG Health Thermometer Sensor or BT SIG Heart Rate Sensor or Custom P2P Server is(are) enabled

RefParameter.Name: CUSTOM_TEMPLATE
RefParameter.Description: Custom template can be enabled only if BT SIG Blood Pressure Sensor or BT SIG Health Thermometer Sensor or BT SIG Heart Rate Sensor or Custom P2P Server is(are) enabled

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BONDING_MODE
RefParameter.Description:
Define Bonding modes
Possible values:
- No-bonding mode(0x00)
- Bonding mode(0x01)

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BONDING_MODE
RefParameter.Description: Define Bonding modes

RefParameter.Name: CFG_USED_FIXED_PIN
RefParameter.Description: Define Fixed Pin option, if set to 1 then CFG_FIXED_PIN will be ignored

PossibleValue.Comment: Do not use a fixed pin (0x01)

RefParameter.Name: CFG_USED_FIXED_PIN
RefParameter.Description: Define Fixed Pin option, if set to 1 then CFG_FIXED_PIN will be ignored

RefParameter.Name: CFG_FIXED_PIN
RefParameter.Description: Any random value between 0 and 999999

RefParameter.Name: CFG_FIXED_PIN
RefParameter.Description: Any random value between 0 and 999999

RefParameter.Name: CFG_ENCRYPTION_KEY_SIZE_MAX
RefParameter.Description: Encryption key maximum size

RefParameter.Name: CFG_IO_CAPABILITY
RefParameter.Description:
Define IO capabilities
Possible values:
- CFG_IO_CAPABILITY_DISPLAY_ONLY (0x00)
- CFG_IO_CAPABILITY_DISPLAY_YES_NO (0x01)
- CFG_IO_CAPABILITY_KEYBOARD_ONLY (0x02)
- CFG_IO_CAPABILITY_NO_INPUT_NO_OUTPUT (0x03)
- CFG_IO_CAPABILITY_KEYBOARD_DISPLAY (0x04)

RefParameter.Name: CFG_IO_CAPABILITY
RefParameter.Description: Define IO capabilities

RefParameter.Name: CFG_MITM_PROTECTION
RefParameter.Description:
Activate/deactivate Define Man In The Middle(MITM) protection mode
Possible values:
- MITM protection not required (0x00)
- MITM protection required (0x01)

RefParameter.Name: CFG_MITM_PROTECTION
RefParameter.Description: Activate/deactivate Define Man In The Middle(MITM) protection mode

RefParameter.Name: CFG_SC_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description:
Define Secure Connections Support
Possible values:
- Secure Connections Paring not supported (0x00)
- Secure Connections Paring supported but optional (0x01)
- Secure Connections Paring supported and mandatory(0x02)

PossibleValue.Comment: Secure Connections Paring supported but optional (0x01)
Secure Connections Paring supported and mandatory(0x02)

RefParameter.Name: CFG_SC_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Define Secure Connections Support

RefParameter.Name: CFG_KEYPRESS_NOTIFICATION_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description:
Define MITM modes
Possible values:
- Keypress notification not supported (0x00)
- Keypress notification supported (0x01)

RefParameter.Name: CFG_KEYPRESS_NOTIFICATION_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Define MITM modes

RefParameter.Name: CFG_USB_INTERFACE_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable USB interface. Mandatory to be set to Enabled for Transparent Mode VCP

RefParameter.Name: CFG_USB_INTERFACE_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable USB interface

RefParameter.Name: CFG_RTCCLK_DIVIDER_CONF
RefParameter.Description:
CFG_RTCCLK_DIVIDER_CONF:
- Shall be set to either 0,2,4,8,16
- When set to either 2,4,8,16, the 1Hhz calendar is supported
- When set to 0, the user sets its own configuration

RefParameter.Name: CFG_RTCCLK_DIVIDER_CONF
RefParameter.Description: Define IO capabilities

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_RESET_BY_FW
RefParameter.Description:
When set, this resets some hw resources to set the device in the same state than the power up
The FW resets only register that may prevent the FW to run properly
This shall be set to 0 in a final product

RefParameter.Name: CFG_LED_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
When set, this resets some hw resources to set the device in the same state than the power up
The FW resets only register that may prevent the FW to run properly
This shall be set to 0 in a final product

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BUTTON_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
When set, this resets some hw resources to set the device in the same state than the power up
The FW resets only register that may prevent the FW to run properly
This shall be set to 0 in a final product

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_BLE_TRACE
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable traces in the BLE services

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_BLE_TRACE
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable traces in the BLE services. CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED and or CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED must be set as well as DBG_TRACE_UART_CFG

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_BLE_TRACE
RefParameter.Description: When set to 1, the traces are Enable in the BLE services

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_APP_TRACE
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable traces in application

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_APP_TRACE
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable traces traces in application. CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED and or CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED must be set as well as CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_UART

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_APP_TRACE
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable traces in application

RefParameter.Name: CFG_FULL_LOW_POWER
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable light traces in the THREAD services. CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED and or CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED must be set as well as CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_UART

RefParameter.Name: CFG_FULL_LOW_POWER
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable light traces in the THREAD services

RefParameter.Name: CFG_LPM_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Low Power mode:
When set to 1, the low power mode is Enable
When set to 0, the device stays in RUN mode

RefParameter.Name: CFG_LPM_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Low Power mode:
When set to 1, the low power mode is Enable
When set to 0, the device stays in RUN mode

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUGGER_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: Debugger enabled.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUGGER_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable debugger, disabled because CFG_FULL_LOW_POWER is enabled. Needs Sys Debug to be enabled as well.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_TRACE
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable traces in the THREAD services

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_TRACE
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or disable debug traces in the THREAD services.
CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED and or CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED must be set as well as CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_UART
Disabled because CFG_FULL_LOW_POWER is enabled

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_TRACE
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or disable debug traces in the THREAD services.
CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED and or CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED must be set as well as CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_UART
Disabled because CFG_FULL_LOW_POWER is enabled

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_TRACE
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable debug traces in the THREAD services

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_LIGHT
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable light traces

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_LIGHT
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable light traces. CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED and or CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED must be set as well as CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_UART

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_FULL
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable full traces

RefParameter.Name: CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_FULL
RefParameter.Description: Enable or disable full traces. CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED and or CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED must be set as well as CFG_DEBUG_TRACE_UART

RefParameter.Name: BLE_CFG_PERIPHERAL
RefParameter.Comment: The device needs to support the Peripheral Role
RefParameter.Description: This setting shall be set to '1' if the device needs to support the Peripheral Role. In the MS configuration, both BLE_CFG_PERIPHERAL and BLE_CFG_CENTRAL shall be set to '1

RefParameter.Name: BLE_CFG_PERIPHERAL
RefParameter.Comment: The device needs to support the Peripheral Role
RefParameter.Description: This setting shall be set to '1' if the device needs to support the Peripheral Role. In the MS configuration, both BLE_CFG_PERIPHERAL and BLE_CFG_CENTRAL shall be set to '1

RefParameter.Name: BLE_CFG_PERIPHERAL
RefParameter.Comment: The device needs to support the Peripheral Role
RefParameter.Description: This setting shall be set to '1' if the device needs to support the Peripheral Role. In the MS configuration, both BLE_CFG_PERIPHERAL and BLE_CFG_CENTRAL shall be set to '1

RefParameter.Name: BLE_CFG_CENTRAL
RefParameter.Comment: The device needs to support the Central Role
RefParameter.Description: This setting shall be set to '1' if the device needs to support the Central Role. In the MS configuration, both BLE_CFG_PERIPHERAL and BLE_CFG_CENTRAL shall be set to '1

RefParameter.Name: BLE_CFG_CENTRAL
RefParameter.Comment: The device needs to support the Central Role
RefParameter.Description: This setting shall be set to '1' if the device needs to support the Central Role. In the MS configuration, both BLE_CFG_PERIPHERAL and BLE_CFG_CENTRAL shall be set to '1

RefParameter.Name: BLE_CFG_CENTRAL
RefParameter.Comment: The device needs to support the Central Role
RefParameter.Description: This setting shall be set to '1' if the device needs to support the Central Role. In the MS configuration, both BLE_CFG_PERIPHERAL and BLE_CFG_CENTRAL shall be set to '1

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_TS_MAX_NBR_CONCURRENT_TIMER
RefParameter.Description:
The user may define the maximum number of virtual timers supported.
It shall not exceed 255

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_TS_NVIC_RTC_WAKEUP_IT_PREEMPTPRIO
RefParameter.Description:
The user may define the priority in the NVIC of the RTC_WKUP interrupt handler that is used to manage the wakeup timer.
This setting is the preemptpriority part of the NVIC.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_TS_NVIC_RTC_WAKEUP_IT_SUBPRIO
RefParameter.Description:
The user may define the priority in the NVIC of the RTC_WKUP interrupt handler that is used to manage the wakeup timer.
This setting is the subpriority part of the NVIC. It does not exist on all processors. When it is not supported on the CPU, the setting is ignored

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_TS_USE_PRIMASK_AS_CRITICAL_SECTION
RefParameter.Description:
Define a critical section in the Timer server
The Timer server does not support the API to be nested
The Application shall either:
a) Ensure this will never happen
b) Define the critical section
The default implementations is masking all interrupts using the PRIMASK bit
The TimerServer driver uses critical sections to avoid context corruption. This is achieved with the macro TIMER_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION and TIMER_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION. When CFG_HW_TS_USE_PRIMASK_AS_CRITICAL_SECTION is set to 1, all STM32 interrupts are masked with the PRIMASK bit of the CortexM CPU. It is possible to use the BASEPRI register of the CortexM CPU to keep allowed some interrupts with high priority. In that case, the user shall re-implement TIMER_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION and TIMER_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION and shall make sure that no TimerServer API are called when the TIMER critical section is entered

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_TS_RTC_HANDLER_MAX_DELAY
RefParameter.Description:
This value shall reflect the maximum delay there could be in the application between the time the RTC interrupt is generated by the Hardware and the time when the RTC interrupt handler is called. This time is measured in number of RTCCLK ticks.
A relaxed timing would be 10ms
When the value is too short, the timerserver will not be able to count properly and all timeout may be random.
When the value is too long, the device may wake up more often than the most optimal configuration. However, the impact on power consumption would be marginal (unless the value selected is extremely too long). It is strongly recommended to select a value large enough to make sure it is not too short to ensure reliability of the system as this will have marginal impact on low power mode

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_TS_RTC_WAKEUP_HANDLER_ID
RefParameter.Description:
Interrupt ID in the NVIC of the RTC Wakeup interrupt handler
It shall be type of IRQn_Type

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable LPUART1 (LPUART1 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only)
Please ensure that in ProjectManager Advanced Settings panel MX_LPUART1_UART_Init Not Generate Function call is ticked and that Vibility is unticked

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable LPUART1.
This specific HW configuration is available only if LPUART1 is available and configured by CubeMX user interface.
LPUART1 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED

Condition.Expression: (LPUART1_TX_DMA1_Channel1 | LPUART1_TX_DMA1_Channel2 | LPUART1_TX_DMA1_Channel3 | LPUART1_TX_DMA1_Channel4 | LPUART1_TX_DMA1_Channel5 | LPUART1_TX_DMA1_Channel6 | LPUART1_TX_DMA1_Channel7 | LPUART1_TX_DMA2_Channel1 | LPUART1_TX_DMA2_Channel2 | LPUART1_TX_DMA2_Channel3 | LPUART1_TX_DMA2_Channel4 | LPUART1_TX_DMA2_Channel5 | LPUART1_TX_DMA2_Channel6 | LPUART1_TX_DMA2_Channel7 ) & Semaphore_CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable LPUART1 DMA TX

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: <font color="red">To enable LPUART1 DMA TX, CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED shall be enabled when available & you need to add relevant DMA request in LPUART1 DMA Settings panel</font>

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable traces USART1 (USART1 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only)
Please ensure that in ProjectManager Advanced Settings panel MX_USART1_UART_Init Not Generate Function call is ticked and that Vibility is unticked

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable traces USART1.
This specific HW configuration is available only if USART1 is configured by CubeMX user interface.
USART1 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED

Condition.Expression: (USART1_TX_DMA1_Channel1 | USART1_TX_DMA1_Channel2 | USART1_TX_DMA1_Channel3 | USART1_TX_DMA1_Channel4 | USART1_TX_DMA1_Channel5 | USART1_TX_DMA1_Channel6 | USART1_TX_DMA1_Channel7 | USART1_TX_DMA2_Channel1 | USART1_TX_DMA2_Channel2 | USART1_TX_DMA2_Channel3 | USART1_TX_DMA2_Channel4 | USART1_TX_DMA2_Channel5 | USART1_TX_DMA2_Channel6 | USART1_TX_DMA2_Channel7 ) & Semaphore_CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable USART1 DMA TX

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: <font color="red">To enable USART1 DMA TX, CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED shall be enabled & you need to add relevant DMA request in USART1 DMA Settings panel</font>

RefParameter.Name: ADV_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of advertising types, can be:
- Undirected scannable and connectable(ADV_IND 0x00)
- Directed non scannable(ADV_DIRECT_IND 0x01)
- Scannable but non connectable(ADV_SCAN_IND 0x02)
- Non connectable and no scan response (ADV_NONCONN_IND 0x03)
- Scan response(SCAN_RSP 0x03)

PossibleValue.Comment: Non connectable and no scan response (0x03)

RefParameter.Name: ADV_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of application types, can be:
- Transparent mode
- Server profile
- Client profile
- Router profile

RefParameter.Name: BLE_ADDR_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of advertising types, can be:
- Public address(PUBLIC_ADDR 0)
- Random address (RANDOM_ADDR 1)
- Resolvable private address (RESOLVABLE_PRIVATE_ADDR 2)
- Non resolvable private address(NON_RESOLVABLE_PRIVATE_ADDR 3)

RefParameter.Name: BLE_ADDR_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of application types, can be:
- Transparent mode
- Server profile
- Client profile
- Router profile

RefParameter.Name: ADV_FILTER
RefParameter.Description:
Advertising policy for filtering (white list related), can be:
- Process scan and connection requests from all devices, i.e. the White List is not in use.(NO_WHITE_LIST_USE 0x00)
- Process connection requests from all devices and only scan requests from devices that are in the White List.(WHITE_LIST_FOR_ONLY_SCAN 0x01)
- Process scan requests from all devices and only connection requests from devices that are in the White List (WHITE_LIST_FOR_ONLY_CONN 0x02)
- Process scan and connection requests only from devices in the White List.(WHITE_LIST_FOR_ALL 0x03)

PossibleValue.Comment: Scan & connect only White List devices (0x03)

RefParameter.Name: ADV_FILTER
RefParameter.Description:
List of application types, can be:
- Transparent mode
- Server profile
- Client profile
- Router profile

RefParameter.Name: CFG_GAP_DEVICE_NAME
RefParameter.Description: Device name; default value is TEMPLATE

RefParameter.Name: CFG_GAP_DEVICE_NAME_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: Device name lenght; max value is 48bytes, default value is 8 (TEMPLATE length)

PossibleValue.Value: 0x04 /* Peripheral and Central Role supported but Peripheral Role preferred for connection establishment */
PossibleValue.Comment: Peripheral and Central Role supported but Peripheral Role preferred for connection establishment (0x04)

PossibleValue.Value: 0x08 /* Peripheral and Central Role supported but Central Role preferred for connection establishment */
PossibleValue.Comment: Peripheral and Central Role supported but Central Role preferred for connection establishment (0x08)

RefParameter.Name: AD_TYPE_SLAVE_CONN_INTERVAL_MIN_HEXA
RefParameter.Comment: Specific Connection Interval Min value Hexa

RefParameter.Name: AD_TYPE_SLAVE_CONN_INTERVAL_MAX_HEXA
RefParameter.Comment: Specific Connection Interval Max value Hexa

RefParameter.Name: AD_TYPE_MANUFACTURER_DATA_NBR
RefParameter.Comment: Number of user defined data item(s)

RefParameter.Name: AD_TYPE_MANUFACTURER_DATA_NBR
RefParameter.Comment: Number of user defined data item(s)

RefParameter.Name: NUMBER_OF_SERVICES
RefParameter.Description: Number of services; maximum is 5

RefParameter.Name: NUMBER_OF_SERVICES
RefParameter.Description: Number of services; maximum is 5

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_LONG_NAME
RefParameter.DefaultValue: Please enter a Service Long Name
RefParameter.Description:
Please enter a Service Long Name
WARNING: this name must :
- not start with "Please"
- not be empty
- contain only "a to z", "A to Z", "0 to 9" and "_" characters

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_SHORT_NAME
RefParameter.DefaultValue: Please enter a Service Short Name
RefParameter.Description:
Please enter a Service Short Name
WARNING: this name must :
- not start with "Please"
- not be empty
- contain only "a to z", "A to Z", "0 to 9" and "_" characters

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_LONG_NAME
RefParameter.DefaultValue: Please enter a Characteristic Long Name
RefParameter.Description:
Please enter a Service Characteristic Long Name
WARNING: this name must :
- not start with "Please"
- not be empty
- contain only "a to z", "A to Z", "0 to 9" and "_" characters

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_SHORT_NAME
RefParameter.DefaultValue: Please enter a Characteristic Short Name
RefParameter.Description:

- not start with "Please"
- not be empty
- contain only "a to z", "A to Z", "0 to 9" and "_" characters

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_TYPE
RefParameter.Description: Type of service, either Primary or Secondary

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_UUID_TYPE
RefParameter.Description: Type of service UUID, 0x01 = 16 bits UUID, 0x02 = 128 bits UUID

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_UUID
RefParameter.Description: Contains the UUID (only 2 bytes are defined by the user for 16 or 128 bits UUID)

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_UUID_TYPE
RefParameter.Description: Type of characteristic UUID, 0x01 = 16 bits UUID, 0x02 = 128 bits UUID

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_UUID
RefParameter.Description: Contains the UUID (only 2 bytes are defined by the user for 16 or 128 bits UUID)

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_VALUE_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: Number of bytes to be written or to notify (1 to 247)

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE1_CHAR1_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE1_CHAR2_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE1_CHAR3_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE1_CHAR4_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE1_CHAR5_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE2_CHAR1_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE2_CHAR2_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE2_CHAR3_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE2_CHAR4_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE2_CHAR5_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE3_CHAR1_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE3_CHAR2_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE3_CHAR3_VALUE_OFFSET
RefParameter.Description: The offset from which the attribute value has to be updated. Only active when CHAR_PROP_NOTIFY or CHAR_PROP_INDICATE is selected. Used in custom_stm.c aci_gatt_update_char_value function

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_ATTR_PERMISSION_NONE
RefParameter.Description: No security

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_ATTR_PERMISSION_AUTHEN_READ
RefParameter.Description: Need authentication to read

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_ATTR_PERMISSION_AUTHOR_READ
RefParameter.Description: Need authorization to read

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_ATTR_PERMISSION_ENCRY_READ
RefParameter.Description: Link must be encrypted to read

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_ATTR_PERMISSION_AUTHEN_WRITE
RefParameter.Description: Need authentication to write

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_ATTR_PERMISSION_AUTHOR_WRITE
RefParameter.Description: Need authorization to write

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_ATTR_PERMISSION_ENCRY_WRITE
RefParameter.Description: Link must be encrypted to write

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_GATT_DONT_NOTIFY_EVENTS
RefParameter.Description: Do not notify events

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_GATT_NOTIFY_ATTRIBUTE_WRITE
RefParameter.Description: The application will be notified when a client writes to this attribute. An @ref EVT_BLUE_GATT_ATTRIBUTE_MODIFIED will be issued.

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_GATT_NOTIFY_WRITE_REQ_AND_WAIT_FOR_APPL_RESP
RefParameter.Description: The application will be notified when a write request, a write cmd or a signed write cmd is received by the server for this attribute. An @ref EVT_BLUE_GATT_WRITE_PERMIT_REQ will be issued.

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_GATT_NOTIFY_READ_REQ_AND_WAIT_FOR_APPL_RESP
RefParameter.Description: The application will be notified when a read request of any type is received for this attribute. An @ref EVT_BLUE_GATT_READ_PERMIT_REQ will be issued.

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_NB_DESCRIPTOR
RefParameter.Description: Value depends of the number of characteristics with the property Notify or Indicate

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE1_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description:
Value depends of the number of characteristics (nbOfChar) with the property Notify or Indicate(nbOfDescriptor)
Max_Attributes_Records = 1 + 2*nbOfChar + nbOfDescriptor

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE1_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description: Value depends of the number of characteristics with the property Notify or Indicate

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE2_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description:
Value depends of the number of characteristics (nbOfChar) with the property Notify or Indicate(nbOfDescriptor)
Max_Attributes_Records = 1 + 2*nbOfChar + nbOfDescriptor

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE2_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description: Value depends of the number of characteristics with the property Notify or Indicate

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE3_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description:
Value depends of the number of characteristics (nbOfChar) with the property Notify or Indicate(nbOfDescriptor)
Max_Attributes_Records = 1 + 2*nbOfChar + nbOfDescriptor

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE3_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description: Value depends of the number of characteristics with the property Notify or Indicate

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE4_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description:
Value depends of the number of characteristics (nbOfChar) with the property Notify or Indicate(nbOfDescriptor)
Max_Attributes_Records = 1 + 2*nbOfChar + nbOfDescriptor

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE4_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description: Value depends of the number of characteristics with the property Notify or Indicate

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE5_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description:
Value depends of the number of characteristics (nbOfChar) with the property Notify or Indicate(nbOfDescriptor)
Max_Attributes_Records = 1 + 2*nbOfChar + nbOfDescriptor

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE5_MAX_ATTRIBUTES_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description: Value depends of the number of characteristics with the property Notify or Indicate

RefParameter.Name: SERVICE_CHAR_LENGTH_CHARACTERISTIC
RefParameter.Description: Type of characteristic length in ble_defs.h. can be either CHAR_VALUE_LEN_CONSTANT(0x00) or CHAR_VALUE_LEN_VARIABLE(0x01)

RefParameter.Name: THREAD_APPLICATION
RefParameter.Description:
List of applications types, can be:
- Full Thread Device with Command Line Interface(FTD_CLI)
- Thread_Coap_GenericFull Thread Device with network configuration(FTD)
- Minimal Thread Device with network configuration(MTD)

PossibleValue.Comment: Full Thread Device with Command Line Interface
Full Thread Device with network configuration
Minimal Thread Device with network configuration

RefParameter.Name: PANID
RefParameter.Description:
Personal Area Network Identifier (PAN ID): an unsigned 16-bit value that specifies the PAN ID.

WARNING!: The PAN ID MUST be different from 0xFFFF value which is reserved for broadcast PAN ID

Value range : 0x0 to 0xFFFE

RefParameter.Name: CHANNEL
RefParameter.Description: 2.4 GHz channel as defined in Section 6.1.2.1 of [IEEE802154]

RefParameter.Name: APPLI_CONFIG_LOG_LEVEL
RefParameter.Description:
List of Log level for Application, can be:
- LOG_LEVEL_NONE (None)
- LOG_LEVEL_CRIT (Critical)
- LOG_LEVEL_WARN (Warning)
- LOG_LEVEL_INFO (Info)
- LOG_LEVEL_DEBG (Debug)

RefParameter.Name: APPLI_CONFIG_LOG_LEVEL
RefParameter.Description:
List of Log level for Application, can be:
- LOG_LEVEL_NONE (None)
- LOG_LEVEL_CRIT (Critical)
- LOG_LEVEL_WARN (Warning)
- LOG_LEVEL_INFO (Info)
- LOG_LEVEL_DEBG (Debug)

RefParameter.Name: CFG_TL_EVT_QUEUE_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description:
Queue length of BLE Event
This parameter defines the number of asynchronous events that can be stored in the HCI layer before
being reported to the application. When a command is sent to the BLE core coprocessor, the HCI layer
is waiting for the event with the Num_HCI_Command_Packets set to 1. The receive queue shall be large
enough to store all asynchronous events received in between.
When CFG_TL_MOST_EVENT_PAYLOAD_SIZE is set to 27, this allow to store three 255 bytes long asynchronous events
between the HCI command and its event.
This parameter depends on the value given to CFG_TL_MOST_EVENT_PAYLOAD_SIZE. When the queue size is to small,
the system may hang if the queue is full with asynchronous events and the HCI layer is still waiting
for a CC/CS event, In that case, the notification TL_BLE_HCI_ToNot() is called to indicate
to the application a HCI command did not receive its command event within 30s (Default HCI Timeout).

RefParameter.Name: CFG_TL_EVT_QUEUE_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description:
Queue length of BLE Event
This parameter defines the number of asynchronous events that can be stored in the HCI layer before
being reported to the application. When a command is sent to the BLE core coprocessor, the HCI layer
is waiting for the event with the Num_HCI_Command_Packets set to 1. The receive queue shall be large
enough to store all asynchronous events received in between.
When CFG_TL_MOST_EVENT_PAYLOAD_SIZE is set to 27, this allow to store three 255 bytes long asynchronous events
between the HCI command and its event.
This parameter depends on the value given to CFG_TL_MOST_EVENT_PAYLOAD_SIZE. When the queue size is to small,
the system may hang if the queue is full with asynchronous events and the HCI layer is still waiting
for a CC/CS event, In that case, the notification TL_BLE_HCI_ToNot() is called to indicate
to the application a HCI command did not receive its command event within 30s (Default HCI Timeout).

RefParameter.Name: CFG_TL_MOST_EVENT_PAYLOAD_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter should be set to fit most events received by the HCI layer. It defines the buffer size of each element
allocated in the queue of received events and can be used to optimize the amount of RAM allocated by the Memory Manager.
It should not exceed 255 which is the maximum HCI packet payload size (a greater value is a lost of memory as it will
never be used)
It shall be at least 4 to receive the command status event in one frame.
The default value is set to 27 to allow receiving an event of MTU size in a single buffer. This value maybe reduced
* further depending on the application.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_TL_MOST_EVENT_PAYLOAD_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter should be set to fit most events received by the HCI layer. It defines the buffer size of each element
allocated in the queue of received events and can be used to optimize the amount of RAM allocated by the Memory Manager.
It should not exceed 255 which is the maximum HCI packet payload size (a greater value is a lost of memory as it will
never be used)
It shall be at least 4 to receive the command status event in one frame.
The default value is set to 27 to allow receiving an event of MTU size in a single buffer. This value maybe reduced
* further depending on the application.

Condition.Diagnostic: Active only if RF, RTC & HSEM are enabled
Active only if RF, RTC & HSEM are enabled
